page.title: 01GENERAL REVIEW OF AREA
page.content: {Area}_ grid ref 080640 containing settlements _ S.Stonely, Gimbers End, Chapel Yard, Wood End, Pertenhall, Chadwell End, Green End & scattered farms & cottages.Population under 1000 98% born in U.K. {Landscape/use}_ undulating countryside rising to 74m. Drained by River Kym. Mostly heavy clay soil;some alluvial. Little woodland.Mainly arable farmland Crops _ grain, oilseed rape,sugarbeet. Some pastures_cattle,sheep.Large fields. No industry,mining, quarrying or towns.New houses at Wood End and Stonely. {Amenities}_ no shops, pubs, hotels. Few public amenities;limited bus service.Nearest main towns-Bedford, Huntingdon.Employment mainly outside area.Farms mechanized,worked by family Few paid workers.Area little changed over last 10 years.Still wealthy area.
